item.title: Feral : Rewilding the Land, Sea and Human Life – George Monbiot (Abridged)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Captivating. Will change the way you think about the natural world, and your place in it’ Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall In Feral, George Monbiot, one of the world’s most celebrated radical thinkers offers a riveting tale of possibility and travel in the wild How many of us sometimes feel that we are scratching at the walls of […]

The post Feral : Rewilding the Land, Sea and Human Life – George Monbiot (Abridged) appeared first on Hoardible.
item.content:encoded:
Captivating. Will change the way you think about the natural world, and your place in it’ Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall

In Feral, George Monbiot, one of the world’s most celebrated radical thinkers offers a riveting tale of possibility and travel in the wild

How many of us sometimes feel that we are scratching at the walls of this life, seeking to find our way into a wider space beyond? That our mild, polite existence sometimes seems to crush the breath out of us? Feral is the lyrical and gripping story of George Monbiot’s efforts to re-engage with nature and discover a new way of living. He shows how, by restoring and rewilding our damaged ecosystems on land and at sea, we can bring wonder back into our lives. Making use of some remarkable scientific discoveries, Feral lays out a new, positive environmentalism, in which nature is allowed to find its own way.

The post Feral : Rewilding the Land, Sea and Human Life – George Monbiot (Abridged) appeared first on Hoardible.

item.title: Underbug : An Obsessive Tale of Termites and Technology – Lisa Margonelli (Abridged)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Who has the answer to the world’s fuel problems? How can we bring ruined land back to life? Where do roboticists turn when they try to engineer a hive mind? Termites. Strange though it seems, scientists look to tiny termites for answers to some big ideas. Lisa Margonelli tracks them, deep into their mounds to […]

The post Underbug : An Obsessive Tale of Termites and Technology – Lisa Margonelli (Abridged) appeared first on Hoardible.
item.content:encoded:
Who has the answer to the world’s fuel problems? How can we bring ruined land back to life? Where do roboticists turn when they try to engineer a hive mind?

Termites.

Strange though it seems, scientists look to tiny termites for answers to some big ideas. Lisa Margonelli tracks them, deep into their mounds to find out how termites can change the world. Underbug: An Obsessive Tale of Termites and Technology touches on everything from meditation, innovation and the psychology of obsession to good old-fashioned biology.

The post Underbug : An Obsessive Tale of Termites and Technology – Lisa Margonelli (Abridged) appeared first on Hoardible.
